login.getStated: Click on Start to proceed with on onboarding steps.

s3.summaryOfInitialConfig: This is summary of initial configuration. You can create an additional S3 account and add additional IAM users of Buckets.

access-key.delete-confirmation: Are you sure you want to delete {key} access key?

download-csv-dialog.message: Save this information, you will not see it again. Download as CSV and close.

account.header-text: Create an S3 account. You must log in to the system using S3 account credentials to manage S3 account, IAM users, and buckets.
account.account-created: Account created: access key and secret key
account.save-info: Save this information, you will not see it again. Download as CSV and continue.
account.url-note: Note: This deployment is not configured with Virtual IP. Please check documentation to get IP Address of public data interface.

bucket.policy-info: Type to add new bucket policy or edit an existing policy in the text area below.
bucket.delete-confirm-msg: Are you sure you want to delete s3bucket

iam.user-key-access: User created:access key and secret key
iam.confirm-msg: Are you sure you want to delete IAM user

csmuser.manage-user-text: Manage users. Depending on the user role, you can create, modify, and delete users. You can also change the password for the admin user.
csmuser.role-text: A role is a collection of permissions granted to a user.
csmuser.note-label: Note: Only admin user can create and delete users and change the password of the admin user.
csmuser.usernameTooltipMessage: The username must be of minimum 4 characters and maximum 56 characters. The username must be alphanumeric and can contain underscore (_) and dash (-).
csmuser.passwordTooltipMessage: Password must contain: Minimum 8 characters, One uppercase letter, One lowercase letter, One special character, One number
csmuser.currentPasswordTooltipMsg: Enter the current password of user
csmuser.user-delete-confirm-msg: Are you sure you want to delete this user?

systemMaintenance.system-info-dialog-message: The services have been restarted. You will have to login again.
systemMaintenance.error-message-onclose: No response, please refresh the page.
systemMaintenance.confirm-message-node-stop: Are you sure, you want to stop the node?
systemMaintenance.confirm-message-node-start: Are you sure, you want to start the node?
systemMaintenance.confirm-message-node-shutdown: Are you sure, you want to shutdown the node?
systemMaintenance.confirm-message-shutdown-sub: Please note that if you shutdown the node then the entire application will stop
systemMaintenance.shutdown-note: Note: {node} is in shutdown state. You need to start it manually.

udx-registration.registration-token: On your Lyve Pilot web portal, choose Add device and then enter the Lyve Rack identifier token provided below.
udx-registration.firstcheck-text: A dedicated Lyve Pilot Bucket will be created in my account.
udx-registration.secondcheck-text: A Lyve Pilot IAM User will be created having complete access only to the Lyve Pilot bucket, and not to other data.
udx-registration.noBucketFound: No Bucket found. Please proceed by creating a new bucket.
udx-registration.loginCreateAccountMsg: Login using existing account or create a new Account
udx-registration.udx-registrationMsg: Review S3 details and connect to Lyve Pilot
udx-registration.onYourLyvePilot: On your Lyve Pilot web portal choose 'Add Device' and then enter the identification token below.

onBoarding.ipAddressUnique: IP address must be unique for VIP and nodes.
onBoarding.manualOption: For Manual option, you must configure Virtual IP address and values for Node 0 and Node 1.
onBoarding.youNeedToConfig: You need to configure a single IP address for management of this system.
onBoarding.useDataSettings: Use the data network settings to setup your system.
onBoarding.youCanSkip: You can skip this step if your data network settings are already complete.
onBoarding.updateStorageEnclosure: Update the storage enclosure firmware. Upload the firmware bundle file (.bin) received from Seagate.
onBoarding.updateStorageEnclosureClick: Click Start update once the bundle file is uploaded successfully.
onBoarding.selectObjectBased: Select an Object-Based Interface (S3) or a Network File System (NFS), or both.
onBoarding.chooseWhichInterface: Choose which interface(s) you'd like to establish. You must pick at least one of these.
onBoarding.startConfigNFS: Start configuration for Network File System (NFS).
onBoarding.notificationSettingsMsg: You can receive notifications about system updates and alerts via email. It is recommended to configure at least one email to receive the notifications and alerts. You have an option to skip configuring the notifications. However, it is not recommended. You should configure at least one email to receive the system notifications and alerts.
onBoarding.notificationConfig: Allows you to configure email servers for notifications.
onBoarding.configLater: You can configure the notifications later. However, it is not recommended.
onBoarding.allowConfigEmailServer: Allows you to configure email servers for notifications.
onBoarding.useManagementNetwork: Use the management network settings to setup your system.
onBoarding.skipManagementSettingAlreadyComplete: You can skip this step if your management network settings are already complete.
onBoarding.configVirtualIP: Configure the Virtual IP address for managing this system.
onBoarding.sslCertificateUploadMsg: By default, the system uses the SSL certificate provided by Seagate. To use a different SSL certificate, click Choose File to browse and select the appropriate SSL Certificate file. Click Upload certificate to upload the selected SSL certificate.
onBoarding.userSettingsMsg: You have already set up a user for managing this system. Use the following screens to add additional user to more finely control access to this system.
onBoarding.chooseUserOptions: Choose the user options below that apply to your administration environment.
onBoarding.selectingLocalUsers: Selecting Local Users will allow you to create and manage any users that can access this system. You can control which users have access to make configuration changes to the system, control which users can access certain interfaces, and setup user attributes specific to individual users.
onBoarding.ifYouConfigureLater: If you intend to configure later, you may skip to the next step.

health.healthMsg: Displays the health of the storage enclosure and the servers (nodes) connected to it.

admin.invalidRootUsername: The username must not be 'root' or 'Root'.
admin.adminConfigurationText: Configure the username and password for the user with administrative rights. You must remember the admin user login credentials because the admin user can be created only once.

alerts.commentCannotBeMoreThan250Char: Comment cannot be more than 250 characters.
alerts.displayAllAlerts: Displays all the alerts which are generated.
alerts.alertsByDefault: All the alerts which are generated, by default are displayed under New Alerts.
alerts.displayAcknowledgedOrResolved: Displays alerts which are either acknowledged or resolved.
alerts.displayAcknowledgedAndResolved: Displays alerts which are both, acknowledged and resolved.

dashboard.healthMsg: Displays the health of the storage enclosure and the servers (nodes) connected to it.

maintenance.downloadOrView: Download or view audit logs for the selected time period.
maintenance.allNodesOnlineNote: Note: Node replacement is only available when any one of the nodes is in shutdown state. In order to complete node replacement please shutdown the node from system maintenance page.
maintenance.updateSoftwareFile: Update the software. Upload the software bundle file (.iso) received from Seagate.
maintenance.updateSoftwareClick: Click Start update once the bundle file is uploaded successfully. After the software update, you must login again.

security.accessDeniedMsg: This is a secure area. You are not authorized to see this page.
security.pageNotFound: The page you are looking for does not exist.

settings.forManualOption: For Manual option, you must configure Virtual IP address and values for Node 0 and Node 1.
settings.managementSettingIPv4Msg: Configure the Virtual IP address for managing this system.
settings.notificationSettingsEmailMsg: Allows you to configure email servers for notifications.
settings.SSLCertificateUploadMsg: By default, the system uses the SSL certificate provided by Seagate. To use a different SSL certificate, click Choose File to browse and select the appropriate SSL Certificate file. Click Upload certificate to upload the selected SSL certificate.
settings.name: Name

widget.adminConfigurationText: Configure the username and password for the user with administrative rights. You must remember the admin user login credentials because the admin user can be created only once.
widget.invalidRootUsername: The username must not be 'root' or 'Root'.

license.header: To set up your system, you must accept the Terms and Conditions.

regex-validation.bucket-input-tooltip: The bucket name must be of minimum 4 characters and maximum 56 characters. Only lowercase, numbers, dash(-) and dot (.) are allowed. The bucket name cannot start and end with a dash (-) or dot(.).
regex-validation.account-tooltip: The account name must be of minimum 4 characters and maximum 56 characters. The username must be alphanumeric and can contain underscore (_) and dash (-).
regex-validation.username-tooltip: The username must be of minimum 4 characters and maximum 56 characters. The username must be alphanumeric and can contain underscore (_) and dash (-). The username must not be 'root' or 'Root'.
regex-validation.password-tooltip: Password must contain: Minimum 8 characters, One uppercase letter, One lowercase letter, One special character, and One number
regex-validation.iam-user-tooltip: The username must be of minimum 1 characters and maximum 64 characters. The username must be alphanumeric and can contain underscore (_) and dash (-). The username must not be 'root' or 'Root'.
